comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-page13811912 this 1927 Sunday Times portrait of Mrs Ray Murdoch (a Hall & Co pic) looks remarkably similar...it also features the same studio back lighting (which we see in many of the Hall ports)...Probably can't be too emphatic just yet, but I think it's her! a bit later ... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128118440 Ha! this 1926 Sunday Times column has a snippet which refers to a farewell given to Mrs Murdoch ('Miss Lottie Andrews') prior to her departure for the United States...this might explain why the name 'Andrew' appears on the slide...all up I'm now convinced we're looking at Lottie Andrew/Murdoch, who evidently worked as a garment designer at Burlei nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128521502 ; per the NSW BDMs she was married in Sydney in 1924...NSW BDMs have her surname as 'Andrew' and her given name as 'Lottie'...so I'd tend to assume NSW BDMs have the correct spelling for her surname (ditto Hall)... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17303840 1937 SMH pic...I suspect there will be quite a bit of bio info on her out there ...per Trove, the PHM evidently have a few of her garments in their collection...(I'm not going there!) Note Hall's numbering 4282...the pics of Peggy Petite (presumably taken ?April-June 1927) were numbered 4314...so if the Hall numbering reflects the chronological order in which which various pics were taken, this pic of Lottie Murdoch might have been taken ? maybe a week or so earlier...However, just to upset this simple theory, the note accompanying the pic of Lottie Murdoch which appeared in the Sunday Times stated that the pic had been taken on her recent return from Europe...and it was then December 1927... POST SCRIPT nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128524233 ...a December 1927 Sunday Times pic of Mary Craven, also by Hall & Co...Mary Craven was then evidently chief designer at Burlei...you can read all about her on Trove...and at the PHM, where they evidently have a bit of a Burlei collection...my hunch is that this pic of Mary Craven might have been taken at about the same time as the pic of Lottie Murdoch...and that both pics might have been intended for use in a Burlei promo... Maybe should have picked up on this one earlier...it comes up if you do a search of the digitised newspapers under 'Hall and Co'...needless to say, I discovered it whilst doing a page-by-page trawl thru the Sunday Times...another case of 'why do things the easy way first'... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article120535477 the marvel that is OCR (Optical Character Recognition) still doesn't quite get everything...these Hall pics of 1920s Sydney socialites are an example of what doesn't turn up via a name search...you need to trawl thru a newspaper page by page to find these...link parked here for possible future reference... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article122805028 Mrs Lenos comes up if you search for 'Hall Studio'...link parked here for possible future reference... nla.gov.au/nla.news-page13811394 Marcia Steizer (another Hall pic)...link parked here for possible future reference nla.gov.au/nla.news-page13810733 Dorothy Coffee...ditto nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128129671 Helen Bruton...ditto nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128521182 visiting Irish singer Sheila Kilgannon...ditto nla.gov.au/nla.news-article126053183 Actress Enid Bennett (ST 1912)...ditto nla.gov.au/nla.news-article117739068 Ida ?McManamy nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128123579 Sydney socialite Thelma Houston
